description: From Latin emigratus, past participle of emigrare (“to move away, remove, depart from a place”), from e (“out”) + migrare (“to move, remove, depart”).

verbs.description: emigrate (third-person singular simple present emigrates, present participle emigrating, simple past and past participle emigrated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To leave the country in which one lives, especially one's native country, in order to reside elsewhere.
examples: They [the Huns] were emigrating from Tartary into Europe in the time of the Goths.
